intro: Phyllagathis lanceolata, commonly known as the lanceleaf phyllagathis, is a flowering plant native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Myrtaceae and is characterized by its lance-shaped leaves and small, clustered flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forest undergrowth. Its leaves are usually glossy and have a distinct aromatic scent. Phyllagathis lanceolata is often found in tropical and subtropical regions, where it plays a role in local ecosystems.
